Also in Rewind: 24 Absolutely Bizarre Historical Events I Can Hardly Believe Actually Took Place

Also in Rewind: If You Can Pass This '80s Slang Test, There's Absolutely No Way You're Under The Age Of 35

title: Sources: University of Utah nearing landmark private equity deal expected to generate $500 million
description: The new venture would generate a massive amount of money for the school in a groundbreaking move that may pave the way for more schools and conferences to do the same.
fullText:
Private equity has officially arrived in college athletics.

The University of Utah is on the cusp of striking the industry‚Äôs first partnership with an equity firm in a marriage that features a nine-figure capital infusion and the creation and shared ownership of a for-profit entity to operate athletics business and financial elements outside of the traditional university framework.

The new venture is expected to generate as much or more than $500 million in capital ‚Äî a groundbreaking and innovative move that may pave the way for more schools and conferences to pursue such a concept.

Finalization of the project is expected soon pending authorization on Tuesday from the University of Utah Board of Trustees. The board is granting the university permission to move forward with the agreement with Otro Capital, a New York-based sports private equity firm.

Multiple officials with knowledge of the project spoke to Yahoo Sports under condition of anonymity.

The endeavor with Otro Capital is more than just a nine-figure infusion of cash.

At the center of the project is the creation of a private, independent offshoot of the athletic department ‚Äî Utah Brands & Entertainment LLC ‚Äî in a first-of-its-kind partnership between a university athletic department and an equity partner. An executive team from Otro Capital, combined with athletics department personnel, will lead the creation and operation of the new company, which will live within the university‚Äôs foundation.

The university retains majority ownership and decision-making authority of Utah Brands & Entertainment. Otro marries the capital infusion with a team of experienced operators. A president from outside the university will preside over the company and report to a board, chaired by Utah athletic director Mark Harlan, with seats for trustees and Otro executives.

The project includes a fascinating wrinkle. The university is offering a prominent group of donors the ability to purchase a stake in Utah Brands & Entertainment. Already, university officials have culled a small donor base to generate millions in purchase agreements. The more than $500 million capital figure includes both the nine-figure cash infusion from Otro as well as those capital commitments from donors.

Utah Brands & Entertainment will house most of the components traditionally held within the university‚Äôs athletic department, including many athletic personnel and divisions. However, fundraising will remain with the school.

The new company‚Äôs primary goal is to generate more revenue across an assortment of areas, including ticketing, concessions, corporate sales and sponsorships. Charged with overseeing and operating the revenue-share pay system for Utah athletes, the new entity provides the department with more flexibility and freedom considering it will operate separate from a public university.

The move isn‚Äôt completely foreign to college sports. Over the last several months, a host of schools ‚Äî Kentucky, Michigan State, Clemson ‚Äî have announced the creation of a private, revenue-generating entity outside of the athletic department as college sports evolves into a more professionalized ecosystem. None of those schools have partnered with an equity firm. However, Michigan State announced its own capital infusion of sorts in the form of a $401 million donation, a portion of which will go toward its new athletics entity.

As for Utah‚Äôs partnership, in exchange for the upfront cash, Otro will earn a large percentage of annual revenues generated from Utah Brands & Entertainment as it splits funds with the university. An exit strategy ‚Äî in five to seven years ‚Äî exists, and the university holds the right to purchase Otro‚Äôs ownership stake.

The emergence of private equity in college sports is a long time coming.

For the last two years, as university athletic departments face mounting financial stressors, dozens of schools pursued private capital or equity deals, including conferences as a whole ‚Äî most notably the Big 12 and Big Ten. However, when these projects reached the finish line, they were stymied for various reasons.

For instance, Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark has twice presented such a deal before his presidential board. Big Ten officials nearly reached the point of a vote on a $2.4 billion capital deal before at least two schools ‚Äî USC and Michigan ‚Äî scuttled the project.

Yormark‚Äôs pursuit of a capital deal caught the attention of Harlan and Utah administrators, who, more than two years ago, began the process that resulted in the potential deal with Otro.

According to its website, Otro seeks to invest in ‚Äúsports teams, leagues and ecosystem businesses with strong intellectual property.‚Äù The company was founded in 2023 by partners Alec Scheiner, Niraj Shah, Brent Stehlik and Isaac Halyard, who all served as senior executives at RedBird Capital Partners, one of the globe‚Äôs largest sports industry investors.

Scheiner has a deep background as a sports investor and team executive, spending time as president of the Cleveland Browns and senior vice president of the Dallas Cowboys. He was the point man for Legends Hospitality, a corporation providing food, merchandise, retail and stadium operations for venues and companies worldwide. Stehlik was the previous president of OneTeam Partners and worked as a chief revenue officer for the Browns.

Otro‚Äôs portfolio includes the Formula 1 Alpine Racing team, FlexWork Sports marketing and event company and Two Circles, a fan and data analytics platform. Otro will own a large share ‚Äî but not a majority share ‚Äî of Utah Brands & Entertainment, similar to its other projects. For instance, Otro invested $200 million in Alpine Racing to own a 24% equity stake.

According to a 2024 story on buyoutinsider.com, Otro was targeting $500 million for a sports-focused investment fund. The company has pitched its college plan to other schools ‚Äî one specifically in the Big Ten ‚Äî before Utah expressed serious interest.

It‚Äôs unclear if Otro has plans to execute similar agreements with other schools.

In Salt Lake City, Otro executives, charged with revenue-generating goals, will have access to the school‚Äôs trademark and licensing rights, facilities, sponsorships and the university‚Äôs teams. However, decisions around coaching staff and player acquisition remain with university personnel.

In fact, the school cleared the partnership with NCAA officials. To remain under the NCAA‚Äôs umbrella, Utah‚Äôs university president and athletic director must retain the majority of decision-making.

title: Stephen Miller‚Äôs Wife Gushes Over Leaving Him for Elon Musk
description: Katie Miller lavished Elon Musk with praise during a fawning interview with the billionaire businessman in which she described how ‚Äúinspirational‚Äù it was to work for him. The podcast host, who previously worked at the White House with her husband, Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller, quit the administration in May to go into the private sector and work directly for Musk. On the latest episode of The Katie Miller Podcast, the unusually animated host gushed over her previous boss months after unc
fullText:
Katie Miller lavished Elon Musk with praise during a fawning interview with the billionaire businessman in which she described how ‚Äúinspirational‚Äù it was to work for him.

The podcast host, who previously worked at the White House with her husband, Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller, quit the administration in May to go into the private sector and work directly for Musk.

On the latest episode of The Katie Miller Podcast, the unusually animated host gushed over her previous boss months after unconfirmed rumors of a relationship between the pair outside the workplace.

‚ÄúEveryone always thinks you‚Äôre a very difficult person to work for,‚Äù Miller said, before adding, ‚ÄúI think you‚Äôre very kind,‚Äù prompting Musk to thank her for the compliment.

‚ÄúPeople think, which you are, like, a very demanding boss,‚Äù Miller continued. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never heard you yell at any employee,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúYeah, I don‚Äôt yell,‚Äù Musk replied.

Miller worked as a spokesperson for Musk as he oversaw the so-called Department of Government Efficiency between January and May this year, before leaving with him to work for the billionaire personally, prior to launching her podcast.

The podcast love-in continued with Miller telling Musk that ‚Äúevery employee who works at every single one of your companies is incredibly mission-driven,‚Äù noting that fact was ‚Äúunlike any other workplace I‚Äôve seen.‚Äù

She went on to single out Musk‚Äôs Starbase compound in South Texas, which was created around SpaceX‚Äôs rocket development and launch site.

‚ÄúLike Starbase is the most inspirational place you‚Äôll ever go to, right?‚Äù Miller said, before claiming that all his employees are ‚Äúfiercely loyal.‚Äù

She added, ‚ÄúYou are a very good employer to work for and I think people assume you are not.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, why would they think anyone would work at the companies?‚Äù Musk pondered out loud.

‚ÄúTalented people can go work anywhere they want... if they‚Äôre mistreated in some way, they would leave and go work somewhere else.‚Äù

Miller‚Äôs podcast has struggled to find an audience after three months. Her first interview, with Vice President JD Vance, remains the most popular on YouTube with 85,000 views. Her lowest-viewed episode has been viewed a dismal 2,700 times.

The Musk interview has already scored more views in six hours than last week‚Äôs episode with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and his third wife, Jen, has clocked up in an entire week.

When news of Miller‚Äôs resignation from her husband‚Äôs place of work first emerged, the Democrats taunted Trump‚Äôs deputy chief of staff with an image of an empty chair in a hotel room, appearing to suggest there was trouble in the marriage.

.@StephenM: https://t.co/IjFdietRgU pic.twitter.com/ndcIsPHWFd

‚Äî Democrats (@TheDemocrats) May 30, 2025

During the podcast, the pair avoided discussion of a mishap in June on Musk‚Äôs social media platform, X, where a fake screenshot of Musk bragging that he ‚Äútook‚Äù Miller‚Äôs wife went viral online, forcing the billionaire to correct his own AI assistant, Grok.

The AI assistant claimed, ‚ÄúThe post from Elon Musk likely existed and was deleted,‚Äù noting that the ‚Äúmetrics and context align with Musk‚Äôs behavior.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe evidence leans toward the post being real but removed, consistent with Musk‚Äôs pattern of deleting controversial posts.‚Äù

Musk then intervened, replying ‚ÄúNo, it‚Äôs fake ffs‚Ä¶ I never posted this.‚Äù Miller never directly commented on the whispers.

title: Turkish student who criticized Israel can resume research at Tufts after visa revoked, judge rules
description: A federal judge has allowed a Tufts University student from Turkey to resume research and teaching while she deals with the consequences of having her visa revoked by the Trump administration, leading to six weeks of detention.  The arrest of R√ºmeysa √ñzt√ºrk, a PhD student studying children's relationship to social media, was among the first as the Trump administration began targeting foreign-born students and activists involved in pro-Palestinian advocacy.  √ñzt√ºrk has been out of a Louisiana immigrant detention center since May and back on the Tufts campus.
fullText:
BOSTON (AP) ‚Äî A federal judge has allowed a Tufts University student from Turkey to resume research and teaching while she deals with the consequences of having her visa revoked by the Trump administration, leading to six weeks of detention.

The arrest of R√ºmeysa √ñzt√ºrk, a PhD student studying children's relationship to social media, was among the first as the Trump administration began targeting foreign-born students and activists involved in pro-Palestinian advocacy. She had co-authored an op-ed criticizing her university‚Äôs response to Israel and the war in Gaza. Caught on video in March outside her Somerville residence, immigration enforcement officers took her away in an unmarked vehicle.

√ñzt√ºrk has been out of a Louisiana immigrant detention center since May and back on the Tufts campus. But she's been unable to teach or participate in research as part of her studies because of the termination of her record in the government's database of foreign students studying temporarily in the U.S.

In her ruling Monday, Chief U.S. District Judge Denise J. Casper wrote that √ñzt√ºrk is likely to succeed on claims that the termination was ‚Äúarbitrary and capricious, contrary to law and in violation of the First Amendment.‚Äù

Government argued that termination was legal

The government‚Äôs lawyers unsuccessfully argued that the Boston federal court lacked jurisdiction and that √ñzt√ºrk‚Äôs Student and Exchange Visitor Information System record (SEVIS) record was terminated legally after her visa was revoked, making her eligible for removal proceedings.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no statute or regulation that‚Äôs been violated by the termination of the SEVIS record in this case,‚Äù Assistant U.S. Attorney Mark Sauter said during a hearing last week. The Associated Press sent an email Tuesday seeking comment from Sauter on whether the government plans to appeal.

In a statement, √ñzt√ºrk, who plans to graduate next year, said while she is grateful for the court's decision, she feels ‚Äúa great deal of grief‚Äù for the education she has been ‚Äúarbitrarily denied as a scholar and a woman in my final year of doctoral studies.‚Äù

‚ÄúI hope one day we can create a world where everyone uses education to learn, connect, civically engage and benefit others ‚Äî rather than criminalize and punish those whose opinions differ from our own,‚Äù said √ñzt√ºrk, who is still challenging her arrest and detention.

The then-30-year-old was one of four students who wrote the opinion piece in the campus newspaper. It criticized the university‚Äôs response to student activists demanding that Tufts ‚Äúacknowledge the Palestinian genocide,‚Äù disclose its investments and divest from companies with ties to Israel.

√ñzt√ºrk, who is Muslim, was meeting friends in March for iftar, a meal that breaks a fast at sunset during Ramadan, according to her lawyer, Mahsa Khanbabai. Her student visa had been revoked several days earlier, but she was not informed of that, her lawyers said. The government asserted that terminating her SEVIS record two hours after her arrest was a proper way of informing Tufts University about her visa revocation.

A State Department memo said √ñzt√ºrk's visa was revoked following an assessment that her actions ‚Äú‚Äòmay undermine U.S. foreign policy by creating a hostile environment for Jewish students and indicating support for a designated terrorist organization‚Äô including co-authoring an op-ed that found common cause with an organization that was later temporarily banned from campus.‚Äù

√ñzt√ºrk running out of time to pursue teaching, research goals

Without her SEVIS status reinstated, √ñzt√ºrk said she couldn't qualify as a paid research assistant and couldn't fully reintegrate into academic life at Tufts.

‚ÄúWe have a strange kind of legal gaslighting here, where the government claims it‚Äôs just a tinkering in a database, but this is really something that has a daily impact on Ms. √ñzt√ºrk‚Äôs life,‚Äù her attorney, Adriana Lafaille of the American Civil Liberties Union of Massachusetts, said in court.

‚ÄúWe are running out of time to make this right. Each day that goes by is a day that she is being prevented from doing the work that she loves in the graduate program that she came here to be part of. Each day that this happens is a day that the government is allowed to continue to punish her for her protected speech.‚Äù

√ñzt√ºrk, meanwhile, has maintained a full course load and fulfilled all requirements to maintain her lawful student status, which the government hasn't terminated, her lawyer said.

Record created to collect information on international students

SEVIS is mandated by Congress in the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 and administered by the director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement ‚Äúto collect information relating to nonimmigrant foreign students‚Äù and ‚Äúuse such information to carry out the enforcement functions of‚Äù ICE.

According to the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, when a SEVIS record is terminated, a student loses all on and/ or off-campus employment authorization and allows ICE agents to investigate to ‚Äúconfirm the departure of the student.‚Äù

McCormack reported from Concord, New Hampshire.

title: Winter Storm Warning Map Shows Which States Will Get 24 Inches of Snow
description: The National Weather Service (NWS) has issued winter weather warnings for Tuesday, Dec. 9, for a range of states, with areas across the U.S. getting anywhere from 1-3 inches of snow to up to 24 inches. The winter storm warnings and advisories say that 14 states across the country are in line to get ...
fullText:
The National Weather Service (NWS) has issued winter weather warnings for Tuesday, Dec. 9, for a range of states, with areas across the U.S. getting anywhere from 1-3 inches of snow to up to 24 inches.

The winter storm warnings and advisories say that 14 states across the country are in line to get several inches of snow from Tuesday, Dec. 9, early morning into Wednesday, Dec. 10, resulting in hazardous travel.

According to research from the National Weather Service, the accumulating snow results from two different winter storm systems. The heaviest snow stretches from the Northern Plains states, Upper Great Lakes, Midwest, mid-Atlantic and Northeast. Even though two different story systems are causing the heavy snow, areas under both systems are experiencing similar conditions.

The NWS has issued winter storm warnings and winter weather advisories for North Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Montana, Wyoming, Vermont, New Hampshire, Michigan, Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, New York and Maine.

An interactive map from the NWS shows that Montana and Wyoming are expected to get an upwards of 24 inches of snow. New York is slated to get up to 12 inches; Wisconsin and North Dakota an upwards of seven inches; Minnesota, Michigan and Pennsylvania up to six inches; and West Virginia, Virginia and Maryland up to three inches.

Meteorologists have also warned of a polar vortex making its way across the U.S. this week bringing record-breaking cold temperatures. So, snow on top of those cold temperatures will make roads even more hazardous.

"The polar vortex is defined as the dominant meteorological system in the winter stratosphere and mesosphere, characterized by a circumpolar west-to-east jet stream that balances extremely cold air over the winter pole with warmer midlatitude air," Science Direct notes.

While the snow is expected to lighten up towards the end of the week, that's not true for the cold. Areas of the Northeast and mid-Atlantic are expected to see their coldest temperatures this weekend, according to research from the NWS.

A winter weather warning, according to the NWS, "indicates that heavy snow of at least six inches in 12 hours, or at least 8 inches in 24 hours, is expected. It can also be issued if sleet accumulation will be at least half an inch. "

In contrast, a blizzard warning means "blizzard conditions (low visibility of less than 1/4 mile due to falling and/or blowing snow, and winds at least 35 mph) are expected for at least three hours."

A winter weather advisory is issued for one or more of the following, according to the NWS: "Snow of 3 to 5 inches in 12 hours, sleet accumulation up to 1/4 inch, freezing rain in combination with sleet and/or snow, or blowing snow."

title: McDonald's and Burger King holiday promotions spark major backlash
description: The food industry is becoming increasingly difficult to navigate as consumer spending slows, operational costs rise, and competition intensifies. In response, many fast-food chains are leaning heavily into menu innovation, rolling out limited-time items and collaborations to attract consumers. This ...
fullText:
The food industry is becoming increasingly difficult to navigate as consumer spending slows, operational costs rise, and competition intensifies.

In response, many fast-food chains are leaning heavily into menu innovation, rolling out limited-time items and collaborations to attract consumers.

This December 2, both McDonald's and Burger King partnered with nostalgic franchises to debut limited-time themed meals and menu items.

However, the demand was so strong that some locations reportedly ran out of several of the limited-time offerings within days of their release, resulting in widespread shortages and sparking customer frustration nationwide.

McDonald's (MCD), in partnership with Dr. Seuss Enterprises, launched The Grinch Meal in the U.S., a festive bundle inspired by the classic "How the Grinch Stole Christmas!" movie.

Although this marked a first time for the U.S., it was introduced last year across select international markets, including¬†Canada, Ireland, Australia, and the UK.

A choice of a¬†Big Mac¬†or¬†10-piece¬†Chicken McNuggets

A pair of¬†holiday-themed Grinch socks¬†in one of four designs

Grinch-themed Happy Meal packaging

Burger King unveiled its own nostalgic collaboration, called the SpongeBob Movie Menu, with Nickelodeon's SpongeBob SquarePants to celebrate the upcoming film "The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants."

The promotion features a themed menu and two bundle meals.

Patrick's Star-berry Shortcake Pie

Pirate's Frozen Pineapple Float

Bikini Bottom Bundle: All four new menu items packaged in a pineapple-shaped Under the Sea Box

King Jr. Meal: A special-edition kids' meal in a pineapple-shaped Under the Sea Box, including one of six collectible SpongeBob toys and a limited-edition crown

As excitement for the new releases surged, many locations of both chains ran out of food items and promotional merchandise far earlier than customers expected, leading to mounting frustration online.

One Reddit user posted a thread claiming their local McDonald's continued selling The Grinch Meal despite running out of socks, only informing them after the order was handed over and had already been paid for, without offering any discount.

title: European leaders agree to fund Ukraine for 2 years but using Russian assets poses a major test
description: Almost four years into Russia‚Äôs full-scale war on Ukraine, European Union leaders have committed to funding Kyiv‚Äôs economic and military needs for the next two years, one way or another.  Ukraine is desperate and needs the money by early 2026.  At a summit next week, the 27 EU leaders will weigh whether to use tens of billions of dollars in frozen Russian assets held in Europe to help meet Ukraine‚Äôs requirements, which the International Monetary Fund puts at 135 billion euros ($157 billion).
fullText:
BRUSSELS (AP) ‚Äî Almost four years into Russia‚Äôs full-scale war on Ukraine, European Union leaders have committed to funding Kyiv‚Äôs economic and military needs for the next two years, one way or another. Ukraine is desperate and needs the money by early 2026.

At a summit next week, the 27 EU leaders will weigh whether to use tens of billions of dollars in frozen Russian assets held in Europe to help meet Ukraine‚Äôs requirements, which the International Monetary Fund puts at 135 billion euros ($157 billion).

Such a move has never been done before, and it comes with risks. The European Central Bank has warned that if Europeans appear willing to grab other countries' money, it could undermine confidence in the euro currency. Some member nations are also concerned about inviting retaliation from Russia.

Belgium, where most of the assets are held, is the main opponent of the plan. It‚Äôs fearful that Russia will strike back, either through the courts or in more nefarious ways. A series of drone incidents near airports and military bases last month suggested that the Kremlin was already doing so, but those responsible were never publicly identified.

European Council President Antonio Costa, who will chair the Dec. 18 summit, has insisted that the leaders should not leave EU headquarters in Brussels until they have reached a decision.

EU leaders froze the money, most of it in Russian Central Bank assets, over the war that Putin launched in February 2022. Moscow has described the scheme as ‚Äútheft.‚Äù

Two plans have emerged. The first would be a ‚Äúreparations loan‚Äù that would use the Russian assets until Moscow agrees to pay for the damage inflicted on Ukraine. Few think Russian President Vladimir Putin will ever agree to pay reparations.

Plan B would be for the EU to borrow the money on financial markets, much as the bloc did to fund a massive loan plan to revive European economies after the coronavirus pandemic.

Many of Europe‚Äôs major economies are cash strapped and mired in debt. But Russia‚Äôs war on Ukraine poses an existential threat to the bloc. Intelligence assessments suggest that Putin could launch a war elsewhere in three to five years should he defeat Ukraine.

The assets make up a substantial pot of potentially ready-to-use cash.

The European Commission, the EU‚Äôs executive branch, estimates that 210 billion ($244 billion) euros worth of frozen assets are currently held in Europe. The vast majority ‚Äî around 193 billion euros ($225 billion) at the end of September ‚Äî are held in the Belgian financial clearinghouse known as Euroclear.

There are political advantages too. Should the EU choose to use the assets, only ‚Äúa qualified majority‚Äù of countries ‚Äî around a two-thirds majority ‚Äî would be required for a green light. Borrowing on financial markets would have to be endorsed by all, meaning that even a single no vote would sink the idea.

Over the last year, Hungary has blocked EU support for Ukraine at almost every turn. The government in Slovakia is starting to dig in its heels as well. A new and stridently nationalist leader in the Czech Republic could further complicate the decision.

Avoiding a veto is in the interest of the vast majority of member countries.

Details of the reparations loan

Unveiling her plan on Dec. 4, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the EU would cover two-thirds of Ukraine‚Äôs needs for 2026 and 2027, for a total of 90 billion euros ($105 billion). International partners would fill the gap.

Due to EU sanctions on Russia‚Äôs assets, cash balances have accumulated at Euroclear. They‚Äôve generated interest ‚Äî some 3.9 billion euros ($4.5 billion) this year, Euroclear says ‚Äî which is already being used to fund a Group of Seven loan plan for Ukraine.

Under the new plan, some of the cash would be transferred to an EU debt instrument. Ukraine would owe the EU the money but would repay only after the bloc‚Äôs sanctions are lifted and after Russia agrees to pay war reparations.

The commission insists that there is no ‚Äútheft,‚Äù as Russia has claimed, because the right of the Russian Central Bank to make a claim on its money and Euroclear‚Äôs duty to repay will remain intact.

Once Putin pays war reparations, Ukraine would repay the EU, the EU would repay Euroclear, and Euroclear would repay the Russian Central Bank.

Importantly for Belgium, the plan contains safeguards to ensure that the risks would be shared by its partners. Other EU countries would offer to guarantee the loan if something went wrong. Germany has already signaled that it would do so.

But the Belgian government has not been assuaged. Even before the commission's reparations loan plan was made public, Foreign Minister Maxime Pr√©vot said that it ‚Äúentails consequential economic, financial and legal risks.‚Äù

Pr√©vot said Belgium ‚Äî a strong backer of Ukraine that has provided military and financial support ‚Äî feels that its concerns are not being heard by its EU partners.

‚ÄúWe are not seeking to antagonize our partners or Ukraine. We are simply seeking to avoid potential disastrous consequences for a member state that is being asked to show solidarity without being offered the same solidarity in return,‚Äù he said.

In an interview with Belgian public broadcaster RTBF last week, Euroclear CEO Valerie Urbain also said that court action could not be ruled out should the EU oblige the clearinghouse to transfer its Russian assets.

title: Oklahoma Turnpike Authority awards $97M for what will be state's longest bridge
description: It's the first project for the East-West Connector Turnpike near Moore, which is part of the agency‚Äôs $8.2 billion, 15-year ACCESS Oklahoma program.
fullText:
Construction soon will start on what will become Oklahoma‚Äôs longest bridge, at least for a little while.

The Oklahoma Turnpike Authority Board on Tuesday, Dec. 9, awarded $97 million to construct the first project for the East-West Connector Turnpike, which is part of the agency‚Äôs $8.2 billion, 15-year ACCESS Oklahoma program. The bridge will connect Interstates 44 and 35, running between Portland Avenue and Pennsylvania Avenue.

Crossland Construction was awarded the project. Darian Butler, director of engineering for OTA, said the bid is about 30% below the engineer‚Äôs estimate.

Joe Echelle, executive director of the OTA, said connecting the area just east of Newcastle to Moore and Norman was a critical path project. He anticipates work on the bridge to start in early 2026 and be completed in late 2027.

The bridge will span the Canadian River, but Echelle said it was designed to minimize environmental impact, in addition to protecting water quality and the habitat of threatened species.

‚ÄúThe bridge piers will be constructed outside of the river channel, and OTA will monitor construction very closely to ensure the contractor complies with all environmental safeguards,‚Äù Echelle said.

Once constructed, it will be the longest bridge in the state at more than 1.25 miles. However Echelle said the Oklahoma Department of Transportation has ‚Äúplans on the shelf‚Äù for a project that will have a longer one.

More: Dozens of crashes keep happening on one part of Turner Turnpike. What's being done?

The board also approved a Resolution of Necessity for the condemnation of three properties along the East-West Connector and Turner turnpikes. A resolution of necessity gives the board‚Äôs approval to move forward with condemnation on a property, but only if necessary, according to the state website.

OTA Transportation Manager Todd Gore said negotiations with a property along the East-West Connector have been unsuccessful with the landowners.

‚ÄúThis does not mean you stop negotiating, but this is kind of at an impasse,‚Äù Gore said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been trying to get a counteroffer, and we have not been able to receive that from them, and we‚Äôve been working over the last month to try and get that.‚Äù

The second and third parcels in the path of a Turner Turnpike project were brought before the board on Tuesday due to title issues.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre working with the landowner to try and get their documentation secure, but they‚Äôre unable to find that documentation to clear the title to get through the closing company, so that‚Äôs why we are requesting condemnation on that," Gore said.

All three properties are currently vacant, according to the agency.

The agency reports 81 total property acquisition agreements to date across the ACCESS Oklahoma program, including parcels on the Will Rogers, East-West Connector and State Highway 375/Indian Nation turnpikes. Additionally, 28 properties have been approved for the resolution of necessity for possible condemnation action, and 13 of the 28 are being prepared for condemnation filing in district court.

This article originally appeared on Oklahoman: OTA awards $97 million for what will be Oklahoma's longest bridge

title: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints appoints 14 men to council, including ‚ÄòChosen‚Äô producer and popular YouTuber
description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints announced that they have appointed 14 men into the Young Men General Council. Among those appointed are several faith-based YouTubers and the cofounder of "The Chosen" TV Series.
fullText:
SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4) ‚Äî¬†The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints announced that they have appointed 14 men into the Young Men General Council. Among those appointed are several faith-based YouTubers and the cofounder of ‚ÄúThe Chosen‚Äù TV Series.

According to the Church, the Young Men Organization directs guidelines, church instruction, and activities for all young men ages 12 to 18 in the church. The Young Men General Presidency, comprised of two counselors and a president, ‚Äúcounsels, inspires, and instructs bishoprics, who lead, teach, and support young men in their congregation and direct the local Young Men organization.‚Äù

The Young Men General Council, including those that have just been appointed, assist the Young Men General Presidency in fulfilling their duties.

Fourteen individuals from Utah have been appointed to the council and they bring a wide variety of experience. Two of them have faith-based YouTube Channels. Additionally, one founded and has worked on ‚ÄúThe Chosen‚Äù, a religious TV series, and many have worked for the Church in a variety of roles.

ABC4 has compiled information about the newly appointed individuals and their educational and professional background, based on public information and biographies from the Church. Notably, this does not include their previous religious service, which can be found on the church‚Äôs website.

Luke J. Nichols in Alaska: Nichols has a degree in political science from BYU and a juris doctorate and previously practiced criminal defense law as a managing partner of Nichols & Green PLLC in Virginia. According to a 2021 social media post from Nichols, he is also the creator behind Outdoor Boys, a popular YouTube channel with over 18 million subscribers. Notably, he uploaded a farewell video on that YouTube channel earlier this year but has continued to upload videos.

Agbor T. Agbor in Salt Lake County: Agbor graduated from the University of Utah with a degree in marketing. Currently, he works as the president of Utah Water Systems LLC.

Derral E. Eves in Hurricane: Eves graduated from Southern Utah University. He is the cofounder and executive producer of ‚ÄúThe Chosen‚Äù and the CEO of Creatus. According to their website., Creatus is a marketing company that has worked with a variety of businesses and creators from Google to Mr. Beast. Within the Church, he has worked as elder‚Äôs quorum president, bishopric counselor, bishop, stake presidency counselor and full-time missionary.

Rogelio Osuna in Herriman: Osuna has a degree in business management from BYU and previously worked for Goldman Sachs. Now, he works for the Church‚Äôs Missionary Department and helps develop missionary training centers across the globe.

Left to Right: Luke J. Nichols, Agbor T. Agbor, Derral E. Eves, Rogelio Osuna. Courtesy: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints

Daniel E. Mendoza Garc√≠a in Santaquin: Garc√≠a has worked in different companies in the production industry after graduating with an associate‚Äôs degree in industrial engineering. He has severed as a counselor in three mission presidencies, high councilor, counselor in a stake Young Men presidency, bishop and bishopric counselor.

John Hilton III in Orem: Hilton previously earned a master‚Äôs degree from Harvard and a PhD in education from Brigham Young University. He works as a professor of religious education at BYU and has published several religious books and online courses.

Walter G. Queiroz Jr. in Highland, Queiroz Jr has a degree in accounting and currently oversees a mining company in Brazil and a commercia janitorial company in Utah.

Left to Right: Daniel E. Mendoza Garc√≠a, John Hilton III, Walter G. Queiroz Jr. Courtesy: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints

Richard P. Kaufusi in Salt Lake County: Kaufusi has earned degrees in education and English from Utah Tech College (previously Dixie College), BYU, and UofU. He has served on several educational and executive boards, including at Primary Children‚Äôs Hospital. Kaufusi now works for Wolfgramm Capital in the manufacturing sector.

G. Sheldon Martin in West Haven: Martin has degrees in political science, mental health counseling and behavioral health from Arizona State University. He has worked for the Church for 21 years and is currently the director of member insights in the Priesthood and Family Department.

Anthony R. Sweat in Springville: Sweat has degrees in painting and drawing from UofU and education from USU. He has worked in the Church Educational System and is now a department chair of Church history and doctrine at Brigham Young University.

Steve K. Mutombo in Lehi: Mutombo has a degree in information technology, a postgraduate diploma in business management, and a Master of Public Administration with an emphasis in finance and information systems. He currently works as a financial consultant at a consulting firm and has previously worked for the Church as a buyer and fleet administrator, travel supervisor and regional support services manager.

Left to right: Richard P. Kaufusi, G. Sheldon Martin, Anthony R. Sweat, Steve K. Mutombo. Courtesy: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints

Clinton E. Udy in Eagle Mountain: Udy is a previous graduate of Idaho State University and USU and now works for the church as a region director for the Seminaries and Institutes of Religion department.

Parker Aaron Walbeck in Lehi: Walbeck teaches video production and social media marketing through on online courses and on his YouTube channel Full-Time Filmmaker, which has over 2 million subscribers. Additionally, he runs a faith-based YouTube channel called True Millennial.

Kazuhiko Yamashita in Provo: Yamashita has degrees in education and sports science and has also studied philosophy of physical education and sports. He currently teaches at BYU and works as an internship coordinator.

Left to right: Clinton E. Udy, Parker Aaron Walbeck, Kazuhiko Yamashita. Courtesy: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints

title: Trump's Bathroom Moment Aboard Air Force One Has Critics Flush With Jokes
description: "The toilet just wanted Trump back inside it," one quipster commented after the president's bathroom door encounter.
fullText:
President Donald Trump got repeatedly hit by an opening bathroom door aboard Air Force One on Tuesday, prompting some potty-mouthed cracks from critics. (Watch the video below.)

‚ÄúThe toilet just wanted Trump back inside it,‚Äù one person wrote¬†in the Mediaite comments section.

Politics: The Supreme Court Gets An Earful About How It Screwed Up Campaign Finance Law

The president was meeting with reporters and warned someone in the gaggle to ‚Äútake it easy with that thing‚Äù (possibly a boom microphone) when the bathroom door opened, jostling him slightly.

‚ÄúHello, somebody‚Äôs in there,‚Äù Trump said to laughter.

He knocked on the door. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon out,‚Äù he said.

The person inside tried to open the door again but Trump inadvertently remained in its way. In a longer clip the trapped bathroom visitor made yet another effort to escape but to no avail.

Politics: Mary Trump Pinpoints The Dark Reason Her Uncle Is So ‚ÄòThirsty‚Äô

Trump kept the mood light during the off-kilter interruption. But some treated it as an opening to dump on him.

‚ÄúTrump‚Äôs not gonna let somebody in the bathroom stop him from lying,‚Äù another wrote on Mediaite.

‚ÄúNext to an open bathroom door is about the only time Trump isn‚Äôt to blame for the stench,‚Äù someone snarked.

One jokester got a bit more personal:

Video: Trump Calls Out Late Night Critics ‚Äî Again!

‚ÄúI‚Äôm guessing Bubba was in that bathroom waiting for a visit from Dozy Don-old.‚Äù

Video highlights on the president‚Äôs jet often feature him snapping at a journalist.

So the loo encounter was perhaps a welcome break.

title: INSTANT REACTION: Avs stave off regulation loss, but drop game to Nashville 4-3 in the shootout
description: The Avs had an opportunity to be the first team to 50 points tonight, but ultimately, they drop their second loss of the road trip in the shootout to the...
fullText:
The Avs had an opportunity to be the first team to 50 points tonight, but ultimately, they drop their second loss of the road trip in the shootout to the Nashville Predators 4-3, finishing their east coast trip 2-1-1.

Brock Nelson starts out the scoring with a beautiful deke and a shot that cracks Jusse Saros early. Unfortunately, Scott Wedgewood, in his first game back has a few not-so-good bounces that lead to goals. Jonathan Marchessault capitalizes on a poorly-tracked puck, and Reid Schaefer catches a stagnant Wedgewood to find the league.

Artturi Lehkonen keeps the Avs from heading into the first intermission down and ties it up to make it 2-2 heading into the second period.

A second period that ends scoreless, a ‚Äòno goals‚Äô commercial come to life. The Avs drew a few power plays, but nothing comes of them, and they head into the third on a split power play.

The third period goes scoreless until just above the seven-minute mark. Wedgewood looks much better in this period, making the first initial saves, but the Preds get it back out high and Brady Skjei finds a lane through traffic (thanks to an unfortunate screen from Sam Malinski) to put Nashville back in the lead.

Fear not, with eight seconds left, Cale Makar finds his first goal on the power play in a while, and they grab a point out of a game that they maybe didn‚Äôt deserve to.

Overtime is scoreless, but Ryan O‚ÄôReilly scores first in the shootout, and he‚Äôll be the lone shootout scorer to push Nashville to win 4-3.

I think he picked up his performance as the game went on, and there‚Äôs certainly a conversation to be had about defensive coverage‚Ä¶

But as far as routine saves go, seems like the two Nashville scored in the first were fairly textbook.

If at first you don't score, shoot again! pic.twitter.com/hjh5tISYc4

‚Äî Nashville Predators (@PredsNHL) December 10, 2025

And I get it, right. This is Wedgewood‚Äôs first game back since his injury (back tightness per Coach Jared Bednar). Totally fine, especially considering he earned this game back a bit with his performance in the third period. But if you track the puck on the first goal better and lateral movement isn‚Äôt nonexistent on the second goal, this game is infinitely easier for the Avs.

Doesn‚Äôt help that concussion spotters pull him after Filip Forsberg‚Äôs shootout attempt‚Ä¶ So, the Avs may have another Wedgewood injury to worry about.

I mean, Cale Makar finally getting his first power play goal since April 3rd, 2025 is an accomplishment, sure. That‚Äôs also a goal at 6-on-4, so I‚Äôm not counting that one (as pretty as it might be).

8 WITH 8 SECONDS TO GOü•¨ pic.twitter.com/iiKIgWeFQ2

‚Äî Colorado Avalanche (@Avalanche) December 10, 2025

This game has an entirely different identity if the Avs can convert on one of the three 5-on-4 opportunities they had in the second period.

I‚Äôm not even sure what has to change, except for maybe putting more than just seven shots on goal in six minutes of having a man-advantage.

Ultimately, it‚Äôs the power play that saves them, but with the third-period lull, you have to get more out of your units in a game like this.

title: Knicks fans think a Giannis Antetokounmpo trade is guaranteed because of a misleading viral tweet
description: Giannis to Knicks false rumor on the fly again!
fullText:
Knicks fans think a Giannis Antetokounmpo trade is guaranteed because of a misleading viral tweet originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The New York Knicks are rumored to be interested in a trade for Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo. The rumor mill was once again ignited after a misleading yet viral post started gaining traction on the internet.

A X user named¬†@BigKnickEnergy_ posted an update, claiming that the Bucks star has just purchased a home in New York. The post has received over 400K impressions within a few hours. Naturally, some were made to believe that it suggests that the Greek Freak was considering a move to New York.

However, it didn't take long to figure out why the post was false. The update came with a screenshot that had 18th Nov, 2025, as the date of purchase. That was almost a month ago.

Giannis Antetokounmpo just purchased a home in New York üòÆüòÆ pic.twitter.com/tvsPYuzCOj

‚Äî Big Knick Energy (@BigKnickEnergy_) December 9, 2025

Yes, he did purchase a property, but over a month ago.

The Bucks star splurged $14.1 million to acquire¬†a 28-unit residential building at 111 Clarkson Avenue, in the Prospect Lefferts Gardens neighborhood of Brooklyn. It is an eight-story apartment building built in 2018. All 28 units in the building are rent-regulated, and¬†the building has an existing tax-abatement benefit under a 421-a program.

It's a real estate investment with the intention to generate cash flow rather than a personal residence. The building joins his investment portfolio.

Meanwhile, as far as the trade rumors tying Giannis to the Knicks are concerned, the parties were closer in August. Antetokounmpo confided in at least one Bucks teammate that he saw the Knicks as a preferred trade destination. Even the Bucks reportedly asked the Knicks to present them with offers involving the former NBA champion. However, it seems the negotiations or the offers were not enough for a deal to come through.

title: ‚ÄúI just keep coming back to it‚Äù ‚Äì Joe Cole once again highlights obvious Chelsea problem
description: Joe Cole will feel like a broken record as he once again highlights a CLEAR problem that this current Chelsea have.I am even more passionate about this issue because it is something that I have been s...
fullText:
Joe Cole will feel like a broken record as he once again highlights a CLEAR problem that this current Chelsea have.

I am even more passionate about this issue because it is something that I have been saying since the new owners put their ‚Äòproject‚Äô in place as well. Many other former Chelsea players, pundits, and fans have been saying the same as well.

Enzo Maresca got snappy last week when a reporter dared suggest that this very young Chelsea side might actually just lack a bit of experience at certain times, but really, he should have acknowledged that actually, yes, maybe it does.

Maresca has taken zero responsibility for his poor subs that he made last night in Chelsea‚Äôs 2-1 defeat against Atalanta in the Champions League, and he‚Äôs actually doubled down on them.

There were very little positives to take from last night, if any, but Joao Pedro certainly did need the goal he scored in the first half to actually put The Blues 1-0 up in the tie.

Enzo Maresca looks dejected on the touchline. (Photo by Carl Recine/Getty Images)

‚ÄòIt‚Äôs¬†really disappointing,‚Äô Cole told¬†TNT Sports¬†after Chelsea‚Äôs 2-1 defeat at Atalanta. ‚ÄòChelsea matched them comfortably in the first half and took the lead.

‚ÄòBut they looked shaky after that and the¬†frailties¬†are clearly there. It‚Äôs frustrating.

‚ÄòThe¬†performances¬†against Barcelona and Chelsea were statements but¬†they‚Äôve¬†followed that up with three below-par performances where the standards¬†haven‚Äôt¬†been there.

‚ÄòI just keep coming back to it, I feel like there needs to be a bit more experience in the squad to help the team get through these tricky games.

‚ÄòThe coaches would have told them what to expect tonight and at Elland Road but¬†there‚Äôs¬†something about having an experienced player in your team to get you through.

‚ÄòChelsea¬†are¬†just not quite there yet.¬†There‚Äôs¬†promise and some great performances but then there‚Äôs performances like tonight which drop off.

‚ÄòIt makes this weekend very, very important¬†because¬†that‚Äôs¬†four games without a win now. The Everton game is must-win.‚Äô

title: Confirmed: Amorim will have to make do without ‚Äòspecial‚Äô star for crunch festive fixtures after new development
description: Ivory Coast announced their squad for the upcoming African Cup of Nations tournament on Tuesday, with Amad Diallo confirmed to be amongst the mix.While it was anticipated that that would be the case a...
fullText:
Ivory Coast announced their squad for the upcoming African Cup of Nations tournament on Tuesday, with Amad Diallo confirmed to be amongst the mix.

While it was anticipated that that would be the case anyway, it has now been set in stone that Ruben Amorim will have to make do without the Manchester United livewire for around a month.

Amad Diallo has been called up by Ivory Coast for the AFCON. pic.twitter.com/CkS7wkgqmq

‚Äî utdreport (@utdreport) December 9, 2025

(Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)

The team aren‚Äôt in action until December 24 when they kick off their campaign against Mozambique in Marrakesh. However, it‚Äôs expected that Premier League clubs will have to release their international players on December 15 ‚Äì the same day United host Bournemouth at Old Trafford in an 8pm kick-off.

That means Amorim could well be without Amad, Bryan Mbeumo and Noussair Mazraoui against a side who‚Äôve recorded successive 3-0 wins in M16 in the last two seasons.

Amorim on his players leaving for AFCON: "The club is talking with the national teams, let's wait for the middle of the week. 

"I don't know for sure but we are doing our job and the national teams are talking with us. That's a good sign, let's see."#MUFC pic.twitter.com/y427hW9Vab

‚Äî Stretford Paddock (@StretfordPaddck) December 8, 2025

AFCON‚Äôs final is pencilled in for January 18, so, in the event that at least one Red makes it that far with their nation, they‚Äôll miss pretty much the entire festive run of fixtures ‚Äì including United‚Äôs FA Cup opener at home to Brighton and Hove Albion in early January.

(Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)

Amad, hailed as a ‚Äòspecial‚Äô talent by MUTV‚Äôs pundits, has started every league game this term except for the defeat to Arsenal on matchday one, while he also missed the trip to face Brentford through bereavement leave.

The 23-year-old has returned a goal and three assists, and has formed a particularly successful relationship with Mbeumo, who‚Äôs scored six times already in his first 15 appearances.

Amorim will be hoping to have Benjamin Sesko back at his disposal as swiftly as possible to help paper over the cracks of his absentees; the striker has been unavailable since before the November international break with a knee injury, but is thought to be edging closer to his return in the coming weeks.

title: Harry Amass: United in talks over new deal
description: Last season, when Ruben Amorim stepped into the Manchester United hotseat, he increasingly relied on the club‚Äôs youth to bail the team out of danger.He handed debuts to Chido Obi, Tyler Fredricson, ...
fullText:
Last season, when Ruben Amorim stepped into the Manchester United hotseat, he increasingly relied on the club‚Äôs youth to bail the team out of danger.

He handed debuts to Chido Obi, Tyler Fredricson, and Harry Amass, and at one stage, the Red Devils were second in the list for minutes afforded to teenagers.

But this season, the head coach has hardly put his faith in Carrington graduates, as Kobbie Mainoo will attest to.

Rather surprisingly, despite the obvious lack of quality on the left flank, the 20-time English league champions opted to send Amass out on loan to Sheffield Wednesday, while choosing to keep new recruit Diego Leon at the club.

The Paraguayan has not managed to make his first team debut, and has looked raw when playing for the U21s, and there are plans to loan him out in January.

Interestingly, Amass‚Äô loan contract with the Owls includes a break clause. The Championship side are desperate to keep him at the Hillsborough Stadium, but United want to revise certain terms before agreeing an extension.

As revealed by The Daily Mail, there is plenty of interest in the ex-Watford starlet‚Äôs services from both the Premier League and Championship.

Harry Amass has two years left on his current United contract, and his parent club have been in touch over a new and improved long-term deal.

‚ÄúThe phone has been ringing off the hook with loan interest from Premier League clubs and Championship rivals, United need to weigh up what their longer term plan is for the teenager ‚Äì and how that impacts his contract.

‚ÄúThe key word from sources on this one is ‚Äòpatience‚Äô. While there is optimism that Amass, 18, can remain at Hillsborough for the remainder of the season, and Wednesday‚Äôs head of recruitment Kevin Beadell is in talks with United, Confidential understands that nothing has been decided right now.

‚ÄúAmass has two years remaining on his deal at United, and while talks are ongoing about what the second half of the season holds, part of the discussions has also centred around a potential new and improved contract.‚Äù

His Player of the Month award at Sheffield Wednesday shows how quickly he has taken to life in the second division. United should ideally look to agree a new long-term deal and send him to a higher-placed Championship side or possibly even a Premier League team in the bottom half of the table.

Feature image Matt McNulty via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Who Could Be Sunderland‚Äôs Difference-Makers Against Newcastle?
description: As we continue our build up to the visit of Newcastle, which of the Lads could be key to our chances on Sunday?
fullText:
Well, just to start off, I‚Äôm absolutely bricking it. I always do, and I always will before the derby.

Our main threat against Newcastle will be down the wings, I expect. Hopefully they field Dan Burn and Kieran Trippier as I feel Romaine Mundle, Bertrand Traor√©, Wilson Isidor, Brian Brobbey, Chemsdine Talbi, Eliezer Mayenda, Enzo Le F√©e and whoever else can play up top can cause real problems for their defence, irrespective of who‚Äôs playing.

Everyone will say Granit Xhaka and Noah Sadiki, but I think the importance is on the attack and their ability to beat their man in the final third.

Like a lot of teams, Newcastle won‚Äôt ‚Äúlike it up ‚Äôem‚Äù, so an on-fire Granit Xhaka is essential.

That may be a go-to answer, so I‚Äôll also give a shout out to Dan Ballard. Apart from his defensive duties alongside Omar Alderete, I think he‚Äôll be able to cause them great concerns from corners¬†¬†and free kicks.

Ballard had an unfortunate FA Cup game in 2023/2024 so he has even more to prove about his development and improvement since then. His surging runs out from the back are becoming more of a feature of his game, as well as his deft chips to set off an attack, so he‚Äôs well capable hurting them in defence and in attack.

Can you imagine a scenario where he scores a late winner? ‚ÄúBALLARD!!‚Äù

A derby game can be decided in a single moment, with any individual player stepping forward to make a difference.

We‚Äôll need a collective effort in terms of performance from all our starters and finishers, but I think Robin Roefs will be just as important as the likes of Dan Ballard, Granit Xhaka and¬†whoever else completes the spine of our side.

Roefs has been in superb form all season and there‚Äôll be difficult moments where we‚Äôll need our Dutch stopper to come to the rescue.

From his aerial dominance ‚Äî which will be tested against the likes of Nick Woltemade ‚Äî to his shot-stopping ability, I back Roefs to make a string of vital saves which could tip the balance in our favour.

It was a tough loss to take at Manchester City but after playing them and Liverpool in such a short period of time, it was a touch too much for our strong but still-developing squad.

That said, we‚Äôve always bounced back from the odd defeat this season, and doing that this weekend will be oh so sweet.

In terms of players, we‚Äôre so much better now than we were in that FA Cup tie, so I‚Äôm confident we can take them on all over the park, to be honest.

Robin Roefs is an amazing goalkeeper and will boss his box and distribute very well.

Trai Hume and Dan Ballard will want revenge for the cup loss ‚Äî especially Ballard after his unfortunate own goal. They‚Äôve both improved massively since that 0-3 loss and surrounded by Nordi Mukiele and Omar Alderete, they‚Äôll be a formidable force for Newcastle‚Äôs attack to try and breach. Nick Woltemade will be a handful but if we can negate Erling Haaland, we can handle him too.

It‚Äôs in the middle and up front that I think we have the main upper hand.

We have the experience, energy and technical prowess in Noah Sadiki, Granit Xhaka and Enzo Le F√©e to hold our own against any side, and they showed that against Arsenal, Chelsea and Liverpool.

Up front, we not have not only Wilson Isidor and Eliezer Mayenda to choose from, but also Brian Brobbey, whereas in the FA Cup, we were playing Nazariy Rusyn with Jobe as a false nine, while a forlorn Hemir sat on the bench.

The step up in quality since that game is within the realms of trading in a battered old mini for a shiny Ferrari. I do hope they‚Äôre all thinking the delta is as it was then, as they‚Äôll get a massive surprise and will be run ragged.

I agree with Anth that the wide men will be key and with Romaine Mundle fit, we have even more options to create out wide and to feed the front men. Both Bertrand Traor√© and Chemsdine Talbi have had great run outs of late too, scoring and working very hard, and Mundle is building up his fitness but is already showing glimpses of his ability.

In short, we have talent everywhere and most of all, we‚Äôre a team of great lads with camaraderie, confidence and spirit, led by a tactical genius.

The Mags only managed to beat Burnley 2-1 at the weekend ‚Äî with an extra man for over half of the game and through a very dubious penalty, and if they play Dan Burn and Joe Willock down the left, I honestly think any of the above lads will have a field day.

Tino Livramento isn‚Äôt a bad right back, but with Jacob Ramsey in front of him, that side can be attacked too.

When we get closer to the weekend I‚Äôll start getting nervy, but I‚Äôm more excited than worried right now. These are the games we wanted back on the list. It‚Äôs more than about league points ‚Äî it‚Äôs about bragging rights after centuries of rivalry.

title: Pedri jokes about Jules Kounde‚Äôs goals after Barcelona win
description: The players were in good spirits after the victory.
fullText:
Pedri couldn‚Äôt help but have a little joke about Jules Kounde after seeing the Frenchman score twice for Barcelona in Tuesday‚Äôs Champions League win over Eintracht Frankfurt.

Kounde became the first player to ever score two headers in a Champions League match for Barcelona as Hansi Flick‚Äôs side took a crucial three points.

Pedri was delighted to see Kounde find the back of the net but wasn‚Äôt sure he actually meant his second goal.

‚ÄúKound√© is a guy who works really hard. He deserves these two goals. They‚Äôll be great for him to keep up the level he‚Äôs been giving us for several years now,‚Äù he told the media.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy for him, because he‚Äôs also a good friend. I‚Äôm sure he didn‚Äôt mean to shoot the second one, but oh well, I‚Äôll ask him,‚Äù¬†he added with a smile.

Kounde actually admitted he was a ‚Äúbit surprised‚Äù to see his second effort end up in the back of the net but also made it clear he was thrilled to score the goals that sealed an important victory.

title: Luke O‚ÄôNien: From League One Losses To His Premier League Debut
description: Despite having an up and down week or so, Luke O‚ÄôNien‚Äôs legacy at Sunderland is one that should give many budding footballers inspiration.
fullText:
Look, even though he got stupidly sent off at the weekend, Luke O‚ÄôNien has fully cemented his legacy as one of the greatest Sunderland players. I‚Äôd even argue that he could receive straight red cards for the rest of his career and still not lose the love of so many supporters.

Luke O‚ÄôNien‚Äôs Sunderland journey is almost a tale as old as time. Brought to Sunderland in 2018 ahead of the club‚Äôs first season in League One, he had quite a rocky start. But O‚ÄôNien thrived at Sunderland, winning the 2018/19 Sunderland Young Player of the Year, featured in the 2020/21 EFL League One Team of the Season, and starred in the promotion winning squad of 2021/22.

O‚ÄôNien‚Äôs real legacy at the club comes from the unhinged antics he gets up to on the pitch. We simply can‚Äôt forget the double whammy of February and March 2023 with the piggyback from Bristol City‚Äôs Alex Scott and the cheeky kiss gifted to Norwich City‚Äôs Jacob Sorensen.

Luke also cemented his status off the pitch through his support for the local community and honesty about his tough adventure in football. This connection with the fans meant that he was awarded ‚ÄòClub Captain‚Äô in 2024/25.

Regardless of his new title, the antics didn‚Äôt stop there. On 31st August 2024, he scored an own goal which single-headedly ended Sunderland‚Äôs 389 minute run without conceding. He tweeted: ‚ÄòNo celebrations for my third goal of the season, but delighted to be the only man to score past Anthony Patterson this season‚Äô. Despite causing us pain, at least he made us laugh along the way.

In December 2024, O‚ÄôNien made club history by shattering the record for the most appearances held at the Stadium of Light.

He then proceeded to get back up to mischief in February, taking out the linesman and deciding to wave his flag. Luke played 47 times in the Premier League promotion winning season and, despite a nasty injury in the 2nd minute of the Playoff Final, he claims he ‚Äòcovered more distance celebrating‚Äô than he did playing.

Fast forward to 2025/26 and it‚Äôs been a tough few months for Luke. After having brought Sunderland all the way from League One for the last 7 years, it‚Äôs been painful for fans to watch him not get any game time due to his injury. However, following him finally being put on the substitute bench against Manchester United in October, O‚ÄôNien posted a very emotional statement to his Instagram:

‚ÄòFrom sitting on the floor in non-league to walking out at the Theatre of Dreams, all in just over a decade. I remember sitting on the grass at Wealdstone because the bench was full, waiting for my chance and hoping for a moment to prove myself. Last weekend, after a long layoff, I was sitting on the bench at Old Trafford in the Premier League. It‚Äôs funny how life comes full circle‚Äô.

Then, at long last, in Gameweek 14‚Äôs midweek clash between Sunderland and current title holders Liverpool, away at Anfield, Luke O‚ÄôNien finally made his Premier League debut.

He was substituted on in the 91st minute for goalscorer Talbi and our emotions were laid bare. I won‚Äôt confirm nor deny whether I shed a tear or two when he was brought on.

In an emotional most-match interview, O‚ÄôNien told: ‚Äòmy wife said my kids were up [and] they were jumping up and down when I came on‚Äô. He continued with: ‚Äòto come this far with this incredible club, with the fanbase, I think, for the first time in my Sunderland career, I‚Äôm lost for words‚Äô.

So thank you, Mr Sunderland, for staying with us through thick and thin. At least you haven‚Äôt been given two straight red cards yet.

Luke‚Äôs full post-match Instagram caption can be read below:

‚ÄúFor years, I‚Äôve dreamed about playing in the Premier League. Some people laughed at me. Some coaches I had when I was little said I‚Äôd never make it. Lots of people told me I wasn‚Äôt good enough and to give up. But I‚Äôve always held on to that dream of playing at the highest level. Deep down I believed that if I just kept working, kept learning, kept showing up every single day, then one day it might happen.

‚ÄúLast night, that dream that 4 year old me had‚Ä¶ came true.

‚ÄúAnd if you‚Äôd told me I‚Äôd make my debut at left wing, up against my mate Mo Salah, I‚Äôd have laughed as well. From non-league in 2014, to being released by Watford in 2015‚Ä¶ there were moments where it felt like this day might never come.

‚ÄúSunderland, you‚Äôve been my home for seven years. I never knew I could fall in love with a club, a city, and its people the way I have. You‚Äôve given me space to grow, to fail, to learn, and to find out who I am as a player and a person. To play even a small part in rebuilding this beautiful club and helping it climb back to where it belongs is something I‚Äôll always be proud of.

‚ÄúMaking my Premier League debut‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm incredibly grateful. Taking a moment afterwards to stand with my mum and dad and breathe it all in‚Ä¶ that was special. But that debut chapter is written now. The focus is on pushing on, improving, growing, and helping drive this club forward with this unbelievable group of players.

‚ÄúSeven years ago we were in League One. Fast forward to last night and we have a team giving everything, disappointed to only get one point against the Premier League champions. If that‚Äôs not a moment to stop, reflect, and feel proud, I don‚Äôt know what is.

‚ÄúThank you to everyone who‚Äôs been part of this journey; my family, my friends, the staff, the supporters, and my teammates.

title: Tigers re-sign Kyle Finnegan to a two-year $19 million contract
description: This is a good start for Detroit.
fullText:
Tigers re-sign Kyle Finnegan to a two-year $19 million contract originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

After dominating for much of the season last year and eventually making the American League Division Series, all eyes have been on the Detroit Tigers this offseason. Would they be able to land a top free agent like Alex Bregman? Would they seriously consider trading Tarik Skubal? Thus far, Detroit hasn't made any moves with the exception of Gleyber Torres signing his qualifying offer.

On Tuesday night, the Tigers signed their first big free agent of the 2025 offseason, agreeing to bring back Kyle Finnegan on a two-year $19 million contract. The contract can max out at $20 million with incentives.

Detroit acquired Finnegan from the Nationals last season and he impressed in 16 games with the Tigers. Across those games, Finnegan posted a 3-0 record with a 1.50 ERA and four saves. Over the last three seasons, Finnegan has recorded 90 saves.

Given the familiarity with Finnegan, the price point and the thinning market for relievers, this is a solid deal for Detroit. Just like last season, Finnegan will work in tandem with Will Vest out of the bullpen, another Detroit reliever with closing experience.

Now, apart from Robert Suarez, Pete Fairbanks and Kenley Jansen, there are few closers left on the free agent market. That said, set-up relievers are still available, including Brad Keller, Luke Weaver, Seranthony Dominguez and Tyler Rogers to name a few.

While this is a good start for the Tigers, you have to think that they'll need to add a bit more to keep pace with other American League contenders.

Seattle rumored to trade for Cardinals left-hander

Detroit once again showing strong interest in free agent Alex Bregman

title: Orioles Have Spoken With Kyle Tucker's Camp as Baltimore Eyes Big Splash This Offseason
description: Baltimore enters the Kyle Tucker sweepstakes after a disappointing 2025 campaign.
fullText:
The Baltimore Orioles are making it clear they want to be players in this year's free agent market, and the latest report suggests they have their eyes on the biggest prize available.

According to MLB Network insider Jon Morosi, the Orioles have spoken with Kyle Tucker's camp about a potential deal.

Morosi reported the news alongside Jon Heyman on Bleacher Report, noting that Orioles president of baseball operations Mike Elias has a history with the four-time All-Star outfielder since Elias was the scouting director in Houston when the Astros drafted Tucker fifth overall in 2015.

The Orioles have spoken with Kyle Tucker‚Äôs camp, as I reported with @JonHeyman on @BleacherReport today. 

Mike Elias drafted him in Houston. @MLBNetwork

‚Äî Jon Morosi (@jonmorosi) December 9, 2025

Tucker is coming off a solid 2025 campaign with the Chicago Cubs where he posted a .266 batting average with 22 home runs, 73 RBI, and 25 stolen bases in 136 games.

His .841 OPS and 143 OPS+ still ranked among the best in the National League even though he dealt with a hairline fracture in his right hand during the summer.

The 5 best hitters still on the FA Market by wRC+ (2025): 

-Pete Alonso (141)
-Kyle Tucker (136)
-Bo Bichette: (134)
-Jorge Polanco (132)
-Ryan O'Hearn (126) pic.twitter.com/tRnUNbjIIX

‚Äî Past The Eye Test Baseball (@PastTheEyeTest) December 9, 2025

Over his eight-year career, the 28-year-old has hit .273 with 147 home runs and 490 RBI while earning four All-Star selections, a Gold Glove Award, and a World Series ring with the Astros in 2022.

Tucker is expected to command one of the largest contracts in baseball history with projections putting his deal somewhere in the range of 11 years and $400 million.

The Orioles are coming off a season they would rather forget. After making the playoffs in back-to-back years in 2023 and 2024, Baltimore finished 2025 with a 75-87 record and landed in last place in the AL East.

They fired manager Brandon Hyde in May when the team sat at 15-28 and were officially eliminated from postseason contention on September 16.

Rosenthal: Orioles, Marlins discussing Edward Cabrera trade.

Other teams are also in contact with Marlins regarding Cabrera. pic.twitter.com/tgBTDQLjZE

‚Äî Underdog MLB (@UnderdogMLB) December 10, 2025

The organization used 70 different players throughout the season and had 29 players spend time on the injured list, which contributed to their struggles.

Now under new ownership with David Rubenstein at the helm, Baltimore is signaling they are ready to spend like a big-market team.

This is not the first splash the Orioles have tried to make this offseason. Reports indicate they offered Kyle Schwarber a five-year, $150 million deal that matched what he eventually signed with the Philadelphia Phillies.

Baltimore has also already traded for slugging outfielder Taylor Ward from the Angels and signed All-Star closer Ryan Helsley.

MLB agent Scott Boras talked Tuesday about the Orioles' interest in former Mets slugger Pete Alonso, who is one of the most sought-after free agents on the market this offseason.

He also said that Orioles president of baseball operations Mike Elias has been in regular‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/c15Ugu8L7R

‚Äî The Baltimore Sun (@baltimoresun) December 9, 2025

Adding Tucker would give the Orioles an elite left-handed bat to pair with Gunnar Henderson, Adley Rutschman, and the rest of their young core.

His swing would also play well at Camden Yards, where left-handed hitters have historically thrived. If Baltimore lands Tucker, they could then package young outfielders like Colton Cowser or Dylan Beavers in trades to address their pitching needs.

The Orioles still have work to do if they want to compete in an AL East that sent three teams to the postseason in 2025, but talking to Tucker's camp is a sign that Baltimore is serious about getting back to contention.

title: How Newcastle could line up in Champions League clash vs Bayer Leverkusen (4-3-3)
description: Newcastle United are set to take on Bundesliga giants Bayer Leverkusen in Wednesday night‚Äôs Champions League showdown at BayArena.The Magpies suffered only their second Champions League defeat last ...
fullText:
Newcastle United are set to take on Bundesliga giants Bayer Leverkusen in Wednesday night‚Äôs Champions League showdown at BayArena.

The Magpies suffered only their second Champions League defeat last time out when French giants Olympique Marseille came from behind to claim a 2-1 win at Orange Velodrome.

Harvey Barnes put the visitors ahead inside six minutes, but it didn‚Äôt take long for that early momentum to fade as Newcastle failed to create another clear opening.

That loss summed up a Newcastle campaign that has been anything but smooth sailing, although they managed to string a three-match unbeaten run since the defeat in France (W2, D1).

Eddie Howe‚Äôs troops come into this game on the back of an unconvincing 2-1 win against Burnley, but it should still boost their optimism ahead of the Leverkusen clash.

Newcastle sit 15th in the Champions League standings after taking nine points from five games, but a win against Leverkusen could send them into the top eight if other results go their way.

There‚Äôs enough reason for Newcastle to be optimistic about their chances.

They arrive in midweek action in decent form, having collected two wins and a draw in their last three outings, scoring eight goals and conceding four.

They also hold fond memories of past meetings with Leverkusen, winning both previous encounters 3-1.

After ripping into his team for failing to control the game better against Burnley, Howe is likely to respond with at least three changes for tonight‚Äôs Champions League contest.

With Nick Pope still struggling to shake off a groin issue, Aaron Ramsdale is set to make his Champions League debut for the Magpies between the sticks.

Lewis Hall will likely come in for Dan Burn while Fabian Schar continues his partnership with Malick Thiaw in the absence of the injured Sven Botman.

Kieran Trippier is also confined to the infirmary, so Tino Livramento should keep his place at right back.

Howe will likely return to his trusted midfield trio of Joelinton, Bruno Guimaraes, and Sandro Tonali after tweaking the set-up against Burnley.

Although he could stick with the same front three of Anthony Gordon, Nick Woltemade, and Anthony Elanga.

title: Braves manager Walt Weiss hints at massive Ronald Acuna Jr. decision for upcoming season
description: It might be time for Ronald Acuna Jr. to return to a very familiar role with the Atlanta Braves.
fullText:
Braves manager Walt Weiss hints at massive Ronald Acuna Jr. decision for upcoming season originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

For the first time in a long while, the Atlanta Braves will not be led by Brian Snitker at the manager position. However, new manager Walt Weiss will get Ronald Acu√±a Jr. fully healthy to start the season. Acu√±a struggled at times last year coming off an ACL injury, but he still managed to make history.

‚ÄúRonald Acu√±a Jr. is the only player to debut in the Divisional Era (1969) to average 30+ HR and 30+ SB per 162 games played (min. 800 games played),‚Äù MLB posted.

He performed well enough to earn NL Comeback Player of the Year, which shows just how good he still is despite two ACL injuries.

‚ÄúAcu√±a, 27, tore his left ACL on May 26, 2024, and returned to the Braves this past May 23 and made his fifth All-Star team. He hit .290 with 21 home runs, 42 RBIs and 9 stolen bases,‚Äù ESPN wrote in November.

The Braves are thrilled to begin the season with Acu√±a healthy, especially as he enters the prime of his career. Weiss is also considering putting him back in the leadoff spot.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs enticing to have him at the top of the order,‚Äù Weiss said. ‚ÄúI really like when a lineup turns over and there‚Äôs teeth right away. If you‚Äôre a pitcher, you‚Äôve got to run through a gauntlet as soon as the lineup turns over.‚Äù

Given Weiss‚Äôs comments, it would not be surprising to see the Braves open the season with Acu√±a leading off. And with Antoan Richardson serving as the baserunning coach, Acu√±a could find even more success on the basepaths.

Acu√±a is ready for another MVP-caliber season, and the leadoff spot is an ideal place to get that rolling. Weiss will ultimately do what he believes is best, but his comments now may hint that this will be the final decision come March.
